CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Ján Šikuta;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä;Vincent A. De Gaetano
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant initiated divorce proceedings and asked PERSON to determine her and her husband 's rights and duties in respect of their minor daughters .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG adopted a judgment in the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a length of proceedings complaint with ORG .
CARDINAL . ORG judgment was served on the applicant on DATE and , in the absence of an appeal , it became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the complaint inadmissible as being manifestly ill - founded . It held that ORG , by adopting the judgment and delivering it to the parties , had taken all required steps in order to eliminate the state of the applicant 's legal uncertainty . This role of ORG had ended by adopting the decision on the merits , that is before the complaint was lodged with ORG . This decision became final on DATE and ORG could not deal with the merits of the case after the initiation of the constitutional proceedings . It was ORG practice to protect one 's right to a hearing without unjustified delay only if the length of proceedings complaint was lodged at a time when the alleged violation still persisted . The decision was served on the applicant 's lawyer on DATE .
